items.preText: Shai Hope and Sunil Ambris walking out to open for West Indies. Mohammad Saifuddin has the new ball. One slip and a gully 10.43am National anthems done, we'll have play soon. Ovi: "West Indies middle order seems pretty inexperienced and thin I would say. If Bangladesh can get some early wicket, it'll be interesting to see how the middle order comes up with that." istiak: "Although Mehidy Hasan Miraz has done wonder in the BD home condition I think he doesn't have the skill to repeat that outside Asia. BD should replace him with naim hasan who has more turn and bounce in his bowling and perfect for this sort of condition." Yamlal Gaire: "Who will open today with Shai Hope?" - Think it'll be Dowrich to partner Hope. 10.20am: West Indies have won the toss and are going to bat John Campbell, who smashed 179 in the first game of the tri-series, is out with a sore back. Shane Dowrich is in. West Indies: 1 Shane Dowrich, 2 Shai Hope (wk), 3 Darren Bravo, 4 Roston Chase, 5 Jonathan Carter, 6 Sunil Ambris, 7 Ashley Nurse, 8 Jason Holder (capt), 9 Kemar Roach, 10 Sheldon Cotterell, 11 Shannon Gabriel Bangladesh: 1 Tamim Iqbal, 2 Soumya Sarkar, 3 Shakib Al Hasan, 4 Mushfiqur Rahim (wk), 5 Mohammad Mithun, 6 Mahmudullah, 7 Sabbir Rahman, 8 Mohammad Saifuddin, 9 Mashrafe Mortaza, 10 Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 11 Mustafizur Rahman Brandon : "Excited for a close contest between two evenly matched ODI teams. Despite Bangladesh having the better of recent exchanges, on a seaming pitch I suspect that the red-hot WI top order will be too much for an unsettled Bangladesh bowling lineup. " 10.16am: While waiting for the toss, you might want to revisit what happened in the first ODI of this tri-series, with the West Indies openers setting a world record. 10am Some sad news coming out of the Caribbean. Former West Indies batsman Seymour Nurse passed away today. Here's a look back at his illustrious career. 9.50am Hello and welcome to ESPNcricinfo's coverage of the Tri-nation series. It's Bangladesh's first outing this series, and they'll be wary of West Indies' dominant batting line-up here. But Bangladesh enter the contest with a slight upper-hand: their recent form against West Indies. Catch up on our match preview before we bring you more news from the contest. If you're a West Indies fan, there are a couple of new announcements. West Indies have announced Shai Hope as vice-captain for the tri-nation series, but wait till you read who the World Cup's vice-captain is!
items.text: Bad ball to start with and you don't bowl that to a man in Shai Hope's form. Too full and on the pads, he flicks it effortlessly to the midwicket boundary
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Hope, FOUR runs

items.text: better line and length, outside off and he lets it go through
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Hope, no run

items.text: too full and too wide, another free gift and Shai Hope has a free swing of his bat to drive it through cover
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Hope, FOUR runs

items.preText: Ominously dark clouds overhead, but hopefully they just stay overhead.
items.text: back of a length outside off, shaping away a touch, and Hope shoulders arms again
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Hope, no run

items.text: good length outside off and he defends to point
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Hope, no run

items.text: good length outside off again, pats it between cover and point
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Hope, no run

items.preText:
Mortaza

Saeed Rasul: "Is it Ambris or Dowrich opening?" - it's Ambris

Hridoy: "Temperature of 12C will be an issue for players. BD said the cold bothered their performance in the practice match. "
items.text: nipping into him from a length and struck on the pads. Loud appeal but the umpire' unmoved. No DRS say the commentators on air
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, no run

items.preText: Looked a good shout, but perhaps a touch high
items.text: oh that's a lot closer That one looked very very adjacent but the umpire turns down a much more vociferous lbw appeal. For my money that would have hit leg. Maybe the umpire thought it was going down. Fuller length, coming into him, and defeated his attempted flick
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, no run

items.text: fuller again outside off and Ambris gets behind this one to get bat on ball for the first time in the over
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, no run

items.text: draw the edge that time, with one that moves a touch away. Ambris looking very uncomfortable, prodded at this outside of. Soft hands so it rolls to slip
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, no run

items.text: back of a length and cutting in again, he wants to swivel flick it off his hips but it takes the thigh pad to short fine leg
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, 1 leg bye

items.text: full and straight, he pushes forward and they take the single off a thick inside edge to square leg
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, 1 run

items.preText: Vinod Rajpal: "Hey saurabh , any thoughts for todays QF1 in IPL ?? Seems you would be here all day !!" - hah, quite! Though I'll be on duty for this game. My colleagues will have the Qualifier 1 up and running in the evening
items.text: back of a length outside off and he lets it go
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Hope, no run

items.text: keeps it on that well outside off line and Hope is happy to shoulder arms again
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Hope, no run

items.text: keeps the length a bit fuller and gets it to shape away but he line is still well outside off. Hope's not interested
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Hope, no run

items.text: once again, full and swinging away but well outside off
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Hope, no run

items.text: brings it closer to the stumps that time and Hope pushes it to cover from off stump
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Hope, no run

items.text: fuller on the fourth stump and patted back to the bowler. Maiden over
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Hope, no run

items.preText: Scott Lowen: "Neutral here in NZ watching the match, that second shout was absolutely plum. Can't understand why he didn't give that out."
items.text: another good length ball in that teasing corridor, he jabs it away into the legside
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, no run

items.text: full and swinging in that time, Ambris pushes forward at it, it takes the inside edge to roll to fine leg
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, 1 run

items.text: good length, nipping into him, punched to mid-on
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, no run

items.text: good length outside off, Hope defends off the front foot to cover
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, no run

items.text: keeps it straighter that time, stump to stump, Hope flicks off a length into the leg side, but can't beat the in field
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, no run

items.text: fuller and driven back but Mortaza gets a hand to it and they decide against the single
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, no run

items.preText: For those asking about the West Indies players in the IPL and why they're not here, this is what Jimmy Adams, chief of selectors, had to say while selecting this squad: "They have selected a squad to Ireland that allows a slightly wider pool of players to get 50-over experience in UK conditions which I think is very important. This is not the World Cup squad, as a number of players are not available for this series as they are still participating in the IPL."
items.text: too far outside off that time and shaping away, so it'll be a wide
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Ambris, 1 wide
